item.title: 波兰通胀加速，再次保持利率稳定
item.description: 在通货膨胀率上升超过中央银行的容忍范围后，波兰将利率稳定期延长至一年。【原文：Poland extended its period of interest-rate stability to one year after inflation picked up beyond the central bank’s tolerance range.】

item.title: 俄罗斯提高天然气产量，但 2024 年天然气产量仍低于战前水平
item.description: 今年前九个月，俄罗斯天然气产量增长了近 9%，有望达到政府设定的目标，但仍远低于乌克兰入侵前的水平。【原文：Russian natural gas output rose almost 9% during the first nine months of this year, putting it on track to meet a government target but still far short of levels before the invasion of Ukraine.】

item.title: 就业市场数据强劲，美联储押注受挫，国债下跌
item.description: 在美国公司上个月增加的就业岗位多于预期之后，美国国债出现下滑，这给正在关注劳动力市场以寻找美联储需要积极降息迹象的交易员们发出了一个喜忧参半的信号。【原文：US Treasuries are sliding after US companies added more jobs than expected last month, sending a mixed signal to traders who are watching the labor market for signs the Federal Reserve needs to aggressively cut interest rates.】

item.title: 法国 11 月电价一个月内下跌超过 20
item.description: 由于水力发电和核能发电的强劲势头使法国电力价格在寒冷的几个月里保持稳定，因此法国电力价格显示出看跌情绪。【原文：French power prices are showing bearish sentiment as strong generation from hydropower and nuclear keeps prices in check for the colder months.】

item.title: 红牛亿万富翁老板获得 2019 年以来最低薪酬
item.description: 由于成本上升和美国的竞争影响了利润增长，红牛公司的亿万富翁所有者获得了四年来最低的报酬。【原文：Red Bull GmbH’s billionaire owners received the lowest payout in four years as rising costs and US competition weighed on profit growth.】

item.title: K2 保险公司加入寻求甩掉私人信用债务的公司行列
item.description: K2 保险服务公司（K2 Insurance Services）正寻求通过将帮助该公司筹集收购资金的私人债务与新的杠杆贷款进行互换来降低借贷成本。【原文：K2 Insurance Services is seeking to cut borrowing costs by swapping private debt that helped fund the firm’s buyout with a new leveraged loan.】

item.title: 芯片公司在飓风袭击矿山后监测石英供应情况
item.description: 在飓风 "海伦 "导致生产全球大部分石英供应的北卡罗来纳州两个矿场停产后，全球半导体制造商正密切关注对该行业至关重要的高纯度石英的供应情况。【原文：Global semiconductor makers are monitoring supplies of high-purity quartz, a material critical to the industry, after Hurricane Helene halted production at two North Carolina mines that produce most of the world’s supply.】

item.title: 瑞士国家银行研究人员发现，瑞士工资增长稳定在略低于 2% 的水平上
item.description: 根据瑞士国家银行经济学家制定的月薪衡量标准，瑞士的工资增长已稳定在央行通胀目标的上限以下。【原文：Wage growth in Switzerland has stabilized below the upper end of the central bank’s inflation target, according to a monthly salary measure developed by Swiss National Bank economists.】

item.title: 亚当-诺伊曼的最新项目是 WeWork 的竞争对手
item.description:
新服务 "Workflow "避免了让他原来的协同工作公司陷入困境的特定商业模式。【原文：

The new service, Workflow, avoids the specific business model that got his original coworking company into trouble.

】

item.title: 英伟达与埃森哲合作推动企业采用人工智能
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）扩大了与技术咨询公司埃森哲（Accenture）的合作，以推动企业采用人工智能，并增加芯片制造商产品的订单。【原文：Nvidia Corp. has expanded a partnership with technology consultant Accenture as part of an effort to drive adoption of artificial intelligence within businesses and boost orders for the chipmaker’s products.】

item.title: 打击伊朗石油设施将使以色列进退两难
item.description:
针对该行业的打击肯定会伤害德黑兰，但也有可能导致价格飙升。【原文：

Targeting the industry would certainly hurt Tehran, but risks sending prices soaring.

】

item.title: 人工智能对菲律宾呼叫中心的 "严重威胁"--人才缺口
item.description: 菲律宾行业组织负责人表示，菲律宾正努力捍卫其在近3000亿美元的全球业务流程外包市场中的份额，它需要在人工智能快速发展的背景下解决日益恶化的技能差距问题。【原文：As the Philippines seeks to defend its share of the nearly $300 billion global business process outsourcing market, it needs to address a worsening skills gap amid rapidly evolving artificial intelligence, the head of the nation’s industry group said.】

item.title: 飓风海伦如何摧毁全球芯片产业
item.description: 飓风 "海伦 "给北卡罗来纳州造成了严重破坏，数十人丧生，其他人受困，房屋、企业和农作物被冲走，水电供应中断。【原文：Hurricane Helene caused havoc in North Carolina, killing dozens of people and stranding others, washing away homes, businesses and crops and knocking out electricity and water.】

item.title: 微软面向消费者推出人工智能，与众多竞争对手一较高下
item.description: 微软刚刚展示了其智能手机人工智能应用程序的新版本，尽管这家软件制造商可能已经落后于竞争对手。但首先...【原文：Microsoft just showed off new versions of its artificial intelligence apps for smartphones, although the software maker may already be falling behind rivals. But first...】

item.title: 降息后新西兰房价下跌速度放缓
item.description: CoreLogic 表示，9 月份新西兰房价连续第七个月下跌，但在央行降息后跌幅有所放缓。【原文：New Zealand house prices fell for a seventh straight month in September but at a slower pace following an interest-rate cut from the central bank, CoreLogic said.】

item.title: 谷歌正在研发推理人工智能，追赶 OpenAI 的脚步
item.description:
这一举措加深了搜索巨头与 OpenAI 的竞争

。【原文：

The push deepens the search giant’s rivalry with OpenAI

】

item.title: 法国计划在 2025 年削减 660 亿美元开支并增加税收
item.description: 法国总理米歇尔-巴尼耶（Michel Barnier）试图挽回不断扩大的预算赤字，并增强投资者对法国的信心，因此法国计划明年削减约600亿欧元（约合664亿美元）的开支并增加税收。【原文：France plans around €60 billion ($66.4 billion) in spending cuts and tax hikes next year as Prime Minister Michel Barnier seeks to claw back a widening budget deficit and bolster investor confidence in the country.】

item.title: 加息、货币困境迫使巴西企业进行反思
item.description: 在利率攀升和货币持续承压的情况下，拉丁美洲最大经济体的高管们正在重新制定计划、重新安排债务和抑制投资。【原文：Executives in Latin America’s largest economy are redrawing plans, reprofiling debt and holding back investment as interest rates climb and the currency remains under pressure.】

item.title: 新加坡政府投资公司（GIC）同意购买 EQT 支持的垃圾处理公司 Reworld 25% 的股份
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，新加坡主权财富基金 GIC Pte 已同意收购废物管理公司 Reworld 25% 的股份。【原文：Singapore’s sovereign wealth fund GIC Pte has agreed to acquire a 25% stake in waste management company Reworld, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 赞比亚计划于 2025 年启动主权财富基金
item.description: 赞比亚将于明年建立主权财富基金，以建立一个雨天缓冲区，保护这个南部非洲国家免受金融冲击，并支持包括卫生和教育在内的关键部门。【原文：Zambia will establish a sovereign wealth fund next year to build a rainy day cushion to shield the southern African nation from financial shocks and support key sectors including health and education.】

item.title: 金丝雀码头利用零售资产为 3.5 亿英镑债券再融资
item.description: 金丝雀码头集团首席执行官肖比-汗（Shobi Khan）表示，该集团希望以其零售资产为后盾筹集新的债务，以偿还 4 月份到期的 3.5 亿英镑（4.65 亿美元）债券。【原文：Canary Wharf Group is hoping to raise new debt backed by its retail assets in order to repay £350 million ($465 million) of bonds maturing in April, according to its Chief Executive Officer, Shobi Khan.】

item.title: 石油流量连续第四个月下滑，这次是因为利比亚
item.description: 由于利比亚的政治风波导致供应中断，石油海运量在 9 月份连续第四个月下降。【原文：The seaborne flow of oil fell for a fourth straight month in September on the back of hefty declines from Libya, where a political row spilled over into supply disruptions.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚要求已经挑衅的债券持有人减息 18
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚建议其 10 亿美元债券的持有者在债务重组中承担 18% 的损失，尽管它承认一个有影响力的投资者团体已事先拒绝了这一提议。【原文：Ethiopia proposed that holders of its $1 billion bond take an 18% loss in a debt restructuring, even as it acknowledged that an influential group of investors has rejected such an offer in advance.】

item.title: 经济形势好转，南非首席执行官看到 "绿芽
item.description: 南非最大的两家金融服务公司的首席执行官表示，自联合政府成立以来，人们对南非的看法有所改善，但南非仍需警惕自满情绪。【原文：Sentiment about South Africa has improved since the formation of a coalition government but the nation needs to be cautious about complacency, according to chief executive officers at two of the nation’s biggest financial-services companies.】

item.title: 南非财政部支持银行家担任非洲开发银行下一任首席执行官
item.description: 南非国库支持非洲开发银行前高级职员巴加布利-斯瓦兹-查巴拉拉（Bajabulile Swazi Tshabalala）成为泛非贷款机构的下一任负责人。【原文：South Africa’s National Treasury endorsed Bajabulile Swazi Tshabalala, a former senior staffer at the African Development Bank, to become the next head of the pan-African lender.】

item.title: 大举押注中国的对冲基金 9 月份收益率超过 25
item.description: 据知情人士透露，随着中国股市飙升，中国的刺激政策在 9 月份给一些对冲基金带来了超过 25% 的回报。【原文：China’s stimulus blitz handed more than 25% returns in September to some hedge funds as the nation’s stocks surged, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。中东紧张局势加剧，石油连续第二天反弹。耐克撤回了其业绩指导后，耐克股价将下跌，而 KKR 正在权衡对一家亚洲芯片制造商的收购要约。以下是市场动态。【原文：Good morning. Oil is rallying for a second day as Middle East tensions mount. US stocks are poised for a muted open following yesterday’s flight to safety, Nike shares are set to fall after the firm withdrew its guidance and KKR is weighing a takeover bid for an Asian chipmaker. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Morwenna Coniam】

item.title: 欧洲关税投票在即，Xpeng 探索本地化方案
item.description: 中国汽车制造商新鹏公司（Xpeng Inc.【原文：Chinese automaker Xpeng Inc. is looking at several options in Europe that may help it to localize production and sidestep tariffs the bloc is levying on electric vehicles made in Asia’s biggest economy.】

item.title: 价值 140 亿欧元的德国铁路股份出售案面临决定性投票
item.description: 德国铁路股份公司（Deutsche Bahn AG）计划以 143 亿欧元（158 亿美元）出售其物流部门，该计划将于周三面临决定性投票。【原文：Deutsche Bahn AG’s planned €14.3 billion ($15.8 billion) sale of its logistics arm is facing a decisive vote Wednesday.】

item.title: 食品价格上涨导致加纳 9 月通胀升温
item.description: 加纳的通货膨胀率在 9 月份出人意料地上升，这是 6 个月以来的首次上升，使人们对决策者关于价格增长将在年底进一步放缓的预测产生怀疑。【原文：Ghana’s inflation rate unexpectedly increased in September for the first time in six months, raising doubts about policymakers’ forecasts that price growth will ease further toward the end of the years.】
